poem:
The Genius Act

In the shadows of power  
a man waves off tangled webs,  
chalking whispers to the wind.  
Cryptic coins shimmer—  
a new currency of control.  
Signatures dance  
on legislative paper,  
while truths spiral,  
an unheard music  
in the silent rooms  
of governance.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump again tries to brush off Epstein crisis as ‘nothing’, blaming Democrats for controversy – US politics live 4.23pm BST According to Trump’s schedule, the “big signing” at 2.30pm will be the Genius Act, the first major legislative overhaul of cryptocurrency regulations which the House passed overwhelmingly yesterday. Upon receiving his signature, the legislation will create new rules for stablecoins, delivering crypto companies a historic lobbying victory. 4.15pm BST Donald Trump has said there will". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
